content.title: Factory status May 2024 (TPM/Eng)
content.layoutDescription: Document layout with text and bullet points
content.visibleText:
Factory status April 2024 (TPM/Eng)

— Summary

Kanban Slots
Jigsaw (1 slot)
IgniteTech #1: Security
IgniteTech #2: Copilot
IgniteTech Maintenance
GFI (1 slot)
Influitive (2 slots)
Crossover (1 slot)
Applied AI (1 slot)
Telco (3 slots + 1 Ops slot)
TPM only slots (1 slot)

Maintenance Delivery scorecard
Burndown charts - road to zero...
All BUs
IgniteTech
CopperTree
Jigsaw
Influitive
What went well:
Responded well to changing BU priorities - took over and made progress on new goals
Did much better in meeting commitments - we believe we will deliver all but one of the Commit +
New goals in Q2
Turned around the Messenger slot - delivered more than planned

What did not go well: wip

Customer adoption for Jive Copilot remains very low – only 2 Cloud customers are actively using it

Maintenance
We have had a great month. We have already delivered 88% of our Q2 orders (goal: 20 tickets per SE7), and we are on track to overhaul for all BUs.
We removed 62% of our backlog in Q2 so far and are on track to eliminate our backlog in Q2.
You can find the delivery scorecard and the burndown charts at the bottom of the document.

Early Customer Adoption
PMs hired in April were assigned to 3 BUs (Ignite, Jigsaw, Influitive). We made progress, but results are below what we would have wanted:
Messenger: of 20 customers, 4 customers showed interest, none has concrete upgrade plans (many went to wait until the new version is proven stable)
Jive Security: Of 12 customers, 3 are interested in upgrading.
Jive Cloud AI Copilot: 2 customers use it actively, 7 have it enabled, most have it disabled

What went well:
Focus on customer problems - conducted calls to understand their problems (for projects in early stages), help them use the product (for AI features), or get them to upgrade (for defense projects)
Focus on business value: analyzing usage (e.g. Jive Copilot Usage Report) and acting upon it

What did not go well:
We started without a clear framework and spent a time aligning expectations, navigating our org, or doing work that we did actually believe to be in our scope
We focused on a subset of customers which we believed to be more interested and got low response rates. We should have contacted all customers to increase the size of the early adoption pool.
Long adoption cycles for hosted projects (Messenger Jive Security) that require customer effort to install make it impossible to demonstrate customer value during the quarter.

Low engagement rate

Improvements we are fixing this by defining the service
TPM Slot - Early Adoption Service

Other topics
Cost reduction: tbd
Providing updates during renewal: TPM will provide content to the Renewals that talks about product investments which will be made available to customers during the renewal process.

content.title: Factory status May 2024 (TPM/Eng)
content.visibleText:
Summary
Slot Delivery
In numbers:
17 commit goals: 6 completed, 8 on track, 3 off track (which, we may fail completing 1)
7 stretch goals: 1 canceled, 3 on track, 3 off track
What went well:
Responded well to changing BU priorities - took over and made progress on new goals
Did much better in meeting commitments - we believe we will deliver all but one of the Commit + New goals in Q2
Turned around the Messenger slot - delivered more than planned
What did not go well: wip
Customer adoption for Jive Colpilot remains very low – only 2 Cloud customers are actively using it
Maintenance
Maintenance had a great month. We have already delivered 88% of our Q2 orders (goal: 20 tickets per SE7), and we are on track for overdeliver for all BUs.
Our backlog age will go down when we remove our backlog.
You can find the delivery scorecard and the burndown charts at the bottom of the document.
Early Customer Adoption
PMs hired in April were assigned to 3 BUs (Ignite, Jigsaw, Influitive). We made progress, but results are below what we would have wanted:
Messenger: of 20 customers, 4 customers showed interest, none has concrete upgrade plans (many went live at Q1 of the customers are prospective)
Jive Security: 12 customers, 3 are interested in upgrading.
Jive Colpilot: 2 customers use it actively, 7 have it enabled, most have it disabled
Influitive AI feature: outreach started recently
What went well:
Focus on customer problems - conducted calls to understand their problems (for projects in early stages), help them use the product (for AI features), or get them to upgrade (for defense projects)
Focus on business value: analyzing usage (e.g., Jive Colpilot Usage Report) and acting upon it
What did not go well:
We started without a clear framework and spent time aligning expectations, navigating our org, or doing work that we did actually believe to be in our scope
We used on a subset of customers which we believed to be more interested and got low response rates. We should have contacted all customers to increase the size of the early adoption pool.
Long procedural cycles for host projects (Messenger, Jive HOP) make it impossible to demonstrate customer value during the quarter.
Low response/engagement rate.
